question: "La Costa", "La Sierra", "La Amazonia" and "La Region Insular" were the four main geographic regions of which country?
explanation: La Costa, La Sierra, La Amazonia and La Region Insular are the four main geographic regions of Ecuador. La Costa consists of coastal regions of the provinces west of Andean range which forms Ecuador's most fertile and productive land and the seat of large banana exportation plantation. La Sierra forms the highlands region which consists of volcanos and snow-capped peaks. La Amazonia consists of Amazon jungle provinces with the largest petroleum reserves. La Region insular region consists of Galapagos Islands.
